alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 7:51PM CDT until May 15 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. .Thunderstorms caused 2 to 4 inches of rain across portions of southern Minnesota Wednesday night. Some localized areas even received amounts greater than 4 inches. Rivers within this region have risen sharply with 2 rising above flood stage. Additional rainfall into this weekend should mean a slow decline in most river levels after cresting. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters begin to impact low lying areas...and some roads along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.6 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 05/22/2017. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
